summary: "Dallas Buyers Club" is a 2013 movie about Ron Woodroof, a cowboy with AIDS in the 1980s. He smuggles drugs to treat his symptoms and helps others with AIDS through the "Dallas Buyers Club," facing opposition from the FDA. The film stars Matthew McConaughey and Jared Leto, who won Academy Awards for their roles. It's based on a true story and tells of Woodroof's fight against the disease and the system. The movie was well-received and made over $55 million.
title: Dallas Buyers Club
